title: Patient Care Technician Interview

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Shirley Ryan AbilityLab
Interview Descriptions: There were three rounds of interviews; 1 phone screen call, and two in-person interviews with various leaders. Ultimately received an offer, but declined due to low salary offer, and no negotiation on their end. Communication with the recruiter throughout the interview process was not the greatest and it looked very unprofessional on their end. It was a hard time getting a hold of the recruiter, and this individual never returned my calls or my emails on a timely manner. I understand recruiters are very busy with many applicants throughout the organization, but it shouldn't take a week to reply to a simple email or call.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were very typical, and not difficult. "Why would you want to work for our organization?", "What makes you stand out compared to other applicants?", and various different situational questions.

title: Physical Therapist Interview

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Shirley Ryan AbilityLab (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied, and was immediately contacted by HR to discuss the position, pay, schedule and hours.  This went fine so they scheduled me to come in person to interview.   So about a week later I leave my current job early to drive cross town to interview.  I get there early, but my interview starts late.  I do not like tardiness.  It set a bad impression already.  When I start the interview, they pop a test which is well over 20 pages on me.  The test isn't terribly difficult, but they're asking me to dictate steps on how to do certain computer processes, which is very difficult when you don't have a computer in front of you.  After I finish this, I interview with the hiring manager.  Standard questions for the most part.   I thought I did pretty good.  But I find out she hasn't seen the test that they made me complete for the job.  And since they were late starting the interview, she abruptly ends the interview in order to catch the train.   This is a part time job.  It was like either she wasn't interested at all.  I asked her for her business card prior to leaving and she didn't have that either.  I've worked on healthcare for many years and currently do now.  But this was one of the worst interview experiences I have ever had.  And for the privilege of all this, I get to pay the "discounted" parking rate of $10 for my pleasure!   So no surprise I never hear back at all on this job.   But I figured as much.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: New Grad RN Interview

That's what I liked most about the interview experience at SRALab compared to other institutions.  I can say the same thing for the nursing recruiter as well.
Interview Questions:
Why work at Shirley Ryan? 

What was your favorite clinical rotation?

In the same week I was brought in for an in person interview with three members of the office team. The next day I was asked for my availability to meet with two employees at the Senior Vice President level. All the in person interviews were very friendly and relatively short. I was asked mainly about my previous experiences, temperament and interests. After my interview I didn't even have time to follow-up with a thank you e-mail as I was called by an HR employee within the hour and offered the position.

Talked about why I picked the specific floor I had applied for and more basic interview questions about how I work in a team etc. Got a call later that day and got the job!

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
